sense.def: Alternative Names shui shang han 水傷寒 , water-borne harm caused by cold; shui sha 水沙 , water-borne sand [disease]. Pathological Condition resembling harm caused by cold brought forth by an affection with an improper qi, with the skin showing small red dots. Ye shi lu yan fang 葉氏錄驗方 Fj: 辨沙病論…大凡才 覺寒慄似傷寒，而狀似瘧。但覺頭痛，渾身壯熱，手足厥冷 , “How to distinguish sand disease : In general [patients] tremble with a feeling of cold as if this were harm caused by cold. The entire appearance is that of malaria. However, they also suffer from headache, and the entire body is very hot. The hands and legs experience recession with counterflow”.
